required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study of an Automated Point-of-Care Urine Diagnostic Device for Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study of an Automated Point-of-Care Urine Diagnostic Device for Pregnancy

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this observational study is to demonstrate the feasibility of an automated point-of-care urine diagnostic device in determining the pregnancy status of patients through urine samples collected from patients at Northwestern University. Our hypothesis is that this automated point-of-care urine diagnostic device will be able to accurately determine a patient's pregnancy status at least 95% of the time.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Time of collection - 1 month post collection
primary_outcome.description: Compare qualitative pregnancy test results generated by Voyant's device with urine pregnancy test result(s) and, if applicable, serum pregnancy test results performed at Northwestern University. From this comparison, we will determine the accuracy of Voyant's device. We will be using the same urine sample used at Northwestern.

arm_group.description: Patient has been determined pregnant with a urine pregnancy test and, if applicable, a serum pregnancy test performed at Northwestern University.
Patient has been determined not pregnant with a urine pregnancy test and, if applicable, a serum pregnancy test performed at Northwestern University.

intervention.description: Detects hormone (hCG, Human Chorionic Gonadotropin) produced by the body during pregnancy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient age 18 years and older, upper age limit of 45 years
- Female patient
- Patients undergoing any procedures for pregnancy diagnosis and confirmation
- English speaking
The following special population will be included:
- Pregnant women
Exclusion Criteria:
- Adults unable to consent
- Individuals who are not yet adults (infants, children, and teenagers)
- Prisoners

overall_official.affiliation: Northwestern University, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology
